column5: Well - I finally made it out onto Lake Ontario fishing. We went out of St. Catharines Marina. I saw Fishmasters charter boat - nice outfit!  We headed out to about the 35 - 40 foot mark and headed towards the mighty Niagara. Fishing was really slow but we marked quite a few fish. After throwing pretty much everything we had at them - I managed to pick up this one as we made our turn to head back up towards St. Catharines. It weighed an even 13 lbs.       That was pretty much it and as we got back to St. Catharines, we were starting to pack up   when this guy hit. It weighed in at 9.4 lbs.        Before you jump all over me about the way we were holding the fish - we knew that we were going release the fish as fast as possible so we combined weigh in time with photo time - thus getting them back in the water as fast as possible.  Hope you enjoyed my afternoon out - I know I did!   Don
Beauty trout tracker. Congrats on your return to the best fishing in Ontario.  L. Ontario is my favourite spot to fish. All species possible and they grow to massive sizes.
Nice fish, congrats on a great outing.
GREAT stuff Don!  And don't worry about the hold...you can't do worse than the charter boat and TV pro's I saw today...throwing them on the floor and torpedoing them back to nature.
Good Job Tracker..nice looking fish!! i kinda thought you woulda got you boat in the water.. seeing as the weather got super nice! and of course i wasnt around  ... Bud
Thanks Tracker ....looks like you had not to bad of a day ....over 100 boats yesterday got the big skunk so ya haven't lost your Lake O touch keep up the good work see ya out there ..Fishmaster
Congrats Don, those are some beauties there.  What a great day to be out on the water too.  Good stuff.  Joey
Good job Don! As long as you don't hold Muskies like that....
looks like u had a great time awesome pics and report keep it up
Nawh - muskies are to smelly to bring in the boat ( LOL )  -  knew as soon as I let them go that we should have taken pictures with the proper hold!  Oh well - next time - I promise!  Don
Right on guys....sounded like a great day to be on the water...thanks for sharing nice sized lakers   cheers
hey don, how much would it cost to go fishing with you?? let me know.. and when
Hey Hey Bud - you know my rates - 1 large timmies - trip/trip   LOL   Don
well, the next time u go out and u want company, let me know bud-e...
Nice job!  Must have felt good being back out in the big water and hauling some nice ones in.

Way to go Don.  You did better than us.  "SKUNKO"  Funny that Carp didn't mention that We counted 42 boats around Jordan Harbour and never saw a fish.  Saw Steve from Hamilton and even he got skunked.  Not one fish entered for our Toonie Tourney. Was great to be out though and had a great day enjoying Carp's company.
WTG Don good to see you catching them after 20yrs.No skunk for you.Nice lakers I hope to catch my first one next weekend.  I can supply the Timmies for Muskie fishing  MTP
